boardgame.name: Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – El Pacífico, 1942
Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – Pacifique 1942
Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – The Pacific 1942
boardgame.description: In 1942, the Japanese empire exploded across the Pacific, conquering everything before them. The only large land mass still held by the Allies was Australia, which they desperately needed as a staging area for a planned U.S. led counter-attack. The Japanese knew of the importance of Australia, but lacked the resources to conquer it, so they decided on the next best thing: Isolate Australia from the United States by building an airfield on the island of Guadalcanal, from which planes could disrupt the Allied supply lines._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The United States, ill-prepared as it was for any offensive actions, immediately attacked with the 1st Marine Division under the command of Major General Alexander A. Vandegrift, caught the Japanese by surprise and easily took control of the airfield. The Japanese 17th Army, under the command of Lt. Gen. Harukichi Hyakutake, counterattacked with an ever-increasing number of troops. For the next four months a titanic struggle took place in the air, on land and on sea as the isolated Marines and U.S. Army fought for their lives to hold their tiny perimeter around the airfield against the might of the Japanese Empire._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; Pacific Ocean 1942 recreates this struggle on your tabletop and includes gorgeous beach and jungles maps of the South Pacific, amphibious landing craft, the USMC, Japanese Banzai Charges, night combat, and much more._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

All games are new _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; still in factory shrink-wrap. *** *** PRE-ORDER *** *** CONFLICT O HEROES GUADALCANAL: $47.95 (pre-order) Academy Games [AYG 5004] Publisher_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Anticipated Release Date: Q2 2011 *** *** PRE-ORDER *** *** SHIPPING Continental U.S. - FedEx: $14.95 International (Including AK _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; HI) - USPS Priority Mail: TBD

ACADEMY GAMES (AYG5014) Dec 7, 1941 - War explodes across the Pacific when the Japanese attack the American fleet at Pearl Harbor. By May 1942, Japan has spread across the Pacific and is threatening America_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s supply lines to Australia after building an airfield on the island of Guadalcanal. The United States counters with an ill-prepared occupation of Guadalcanal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s airfield with the 1st Marine Division. The Japanese retaliate with vengeance, cutting off the Marines by sea and pouring in thousands of Japanese reinforcements. A desperate struggle ensues, as the Americans try to hold on to their tiny foothold against the might of the Japanese Empire. Guadalcanal continues the multi-award winning Conflict of Heroes series. In this game, players command platoons and companies of individual squads and tanks to resolve the same tactical dilemmas that commanders faced during some of the most ferocious engagements of WWII. In Guadalcanal, the Americans track VPs, but the Japanese track Bushido. If a Japanese commander _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;loses face_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; during battle, his command and men_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s morale can crumble. This is a groundbreaking new concept that forces players to think like their 1942 counterparts. CoH features a fast and fluid system that is easy to learn but realistic to all of the unique theaters of battle portrayed.
Box rupture, no interior damage.
